sen.j: 中井 正清（なかい まさきよ、永禄8年（1565年） - 元和 (日本)5年1月21日 (旧暦)（1619年3月7日））は、江戸時代初期の大工頭。
sen.e: Masakiyo NAKAI (1565-March 7, 1619) was the Daikugashira (construction prefect) in early Edo era.

sen.j: 初代の京都大工頭であり、大和国国司、従四位下。
sen.e: He was the first Kyoto Daikugashira (Daikugashira in Kyoto) with titles of Yamato-no-kuni (Yamato Province) Kokushi (district governors sent by the government) and Jushi-no-ge Rank (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

He was the first Kyoto Daikugashira with the title of Yamato no kuni Kokushi (the governor of Yamato Province) and with the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: 大和国国司→Yamato no kuni Kokushi (the governor of Yamato Province)としました。

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦いの後、徳川家康に作事方として仕え、二条城建設に活躍した。
sen.e: He served as the construction officer for Ieyasu TOKUGAWA after the Battle of Sekigahara and participated in the construction of the Nijo Castle.

sen.cmt: 二条城→Nijo-jo Castleとしました。

sen.j: 江戸城、知恩院、駿府城の天守、江戸の町割り、増上寺、名古屋城、内裏、日光東照宮など、徳川氏関係の重要な建築を担当した。
sen.e: He managed the construction of many important architectures related to the Tokugawa clan, including Edo Castle, Chionin, Tenshu (castle tower) of Sunpu Castle, scale of town planning in Edo, Zojo-ji Temple, Nagoya Castle, Dairi, and Nikko Toshogu.

He managed the construction of many important architectural structures related to the Tokugawa clan, including Edo-jo Castle, Chion-in Temple, Tenshu (castle tower) of Sunpu-jo Castle, the scale of town planning in Edo, Zojo-ji Temple, Nagoya-jo Castle, Dairi (Imperial Palace), Nikko Toshogu Shrine, and so on.
